info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 9 at 11:30AM EDT until June 10 at 2:02PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis IN has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana...
Mississinewa River near Ridgeville.
.Rainfall amounts of an inch to near three inches over the weekend into this morning will bring minor to possibly low end moderate flooding to the Mississinewa River near Ridgeville. The river is expected to see a crest this evening similar to but a bit lower than Sunday evening. If additional rainfall develops over that basin this afternoon the crest could be higher.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Mississinewa River near Ridgeville.
* WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 11.5 feet, Water on the shoulder and edge of SR 1 south of the junction with SR 28 in western Randolph County.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM EDT Monday the stage was 9.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning to a crest of 11.9 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued late tonight by around 230 AM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON
